smells.name: ExplicitGarbageCollectionCall

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (getVerse("Rom.1.3")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: getVerse("Rom.1.3")
Parentheses in (getVerse("Rom.1.4")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: getVerse("Rom.1.4")
Parentheses in (getVerse("Rom.1.4")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: getVerse("Rom.1.4")
Parentheses in (getVerse("Rom.1.5")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: getVerse("Rom.1.5")
Parentheses in (getVerse("Rom.1.5")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: getVerse("Rom.1.5")

Parentheses in (windowControl.windowRepository.isMaximisedState && !window.isLinksWindow) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: windowControl.windowRepository.isMaximisedState && !window.isLinksWindow

Parentheses in (mainBibleActivity.topOffsetWithActionBarAndStatusBar
                    / mainBibleActivity.resources.displayMetrics.density) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: mainBibleActivity.topOffsetWithActionBarAndStatusBar
                    / mainBibleActivity.resources.displayMetrics.density
Parentheses around the lambda ({newWorkspace()}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({cloneWorkspace()}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (verse.after(start) && verse.before(end)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: verse.after(start) && verse.before(end)
Parentheses in (a != null && a == b) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: a != null && a == b
Parentheses in (chapter == other.chapter && verse > other.verse) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: chapter == other.chapter && verse > other.verse
Parentheses in (chapter == other.chapter && verse < other.verse) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: chapter == other.chapter && verse < other.verse
Parentheses in (chapter == other.chapter) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: chapter == other.chapter
Parentheses in (initialized && !isVisible) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: initialized && !isVisible
Parentheses around the lambda ({ it.isEmpty() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (attrs?.getValue("type")?: "") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: attrs?.getValue("type")?: ""

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
